intro: Cephalomanes elegans, commonly known as the elegant sea hare, is a species of sea hare found in tropical and subtropical marine environments. It belongs to the family Aplysiidae and is characterized by its soft, gelatinous body and distinctive, often colorful skin. The plant, or more accurately the animal, has a radula used for feeding on algae and other plant matter. Its anatomy includes a muscular foot for movement and a mantle that houses its internal organs. Cephalomanes elegans plays a role in marine ecosystems by contributing to nutrient cycling and serving as prey for various marine predators.
